hero.title: Daniela Sofrone
hero.subtitle: I bring product thinking into ambiguous projects — aligning stakeholders, defining the right problem, and shipping pragmatic solutions.
introduction.text.one: I’m a Product Manager with a background in development. I help teams turn complex requirements into digital products that make sense for both users and the business. I started my career writing code and solving detailed technical problems. Over time, my focus shifted from how things are built to why they should be built — understanding user needs, aligning stakeholders, and making clear product decisions in ambiguous environments.
introduction.text.two: In my recent roles, I’ve worked primarily as a Product Owner within cross-functional teams, with a strong focus on discovery, prioritization, and delivery. This experience shaped how I think about product work: creating clarity, connecting perspectives, and enabling teams to build the right things, not just build things right.
introduction.text.three: I’ve contributed to both B2B and B2C products, balancing business goals, user needs, and technical feasibility. My background in frontend development and QA helps me bridge conversations between business, design, and engineering, especially when complexity is high.
introduction.text.four: What motivates me most is product work that starts from real user problems and leads to meaningful outcomes — building solutions that are useful, sustainable, and make a real difference.
